definition: to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: The enterprise in undertakes in the social responsibility process to have blindness.
sentences.chinese: 企业在承当社会义务过程中具有自觉性。
是耶稣承当了所有“转账”的刑罚。

sentences.english: No one wants to take responsibility when things go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 没有人想在事情出错的时候来承当责任。

sentences.english: The marine insurance shall covered by us.
sentences.chinese: 海上保险的费用将由我方承当。

sentences.english: But I'm afraid my little kids are unready for that kind of responsibility yet.
sentences.chinese: 但生怕我的小孩还没有打算好承当起那种义务。

sentences.english: People who act as catalysts and assume the responsibility for managing the change process.
sentences.chinese: 作为催化剂起作用的并承当变革过程管理责任的人。

sentences.english: We have to assume the construction of homeland, prosperous homeland responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 咱们就要承当起建设故乡，繁华故乡的责任。

definition: to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
